channel.title: Time for a new start
channel.description:
I've been judging these new updates on RuneScape by general feedback (mostly from this forum), so I never wanted to even log into the game and see the changes for myself. I decided to create a new account and learn about all the new updates by experience, and it has been really fun so far. There are a few things that could be better, or even completely changed, but the game is fun for the most part. In all honesty, I've never had this much fun training combat until now, and I'm only killing cows.
I really think most of you should reconsider your thought about the updates and try it out for yourself.

item.title: Time for a new start
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

the elve age:

Tried it… still hate it

Same. I tried Beta, tried to give my feedback and stop it as much as possible, but it was bound to happen and as I predicted, it cause a major loss of their playerbase and alienated 90% of their community.
I quit the day EoC was released.

Read full topic

item.title: Time for a new start
item.dc:creator: @Ashley3 Ashley
item.description:
@Ashley3 wrote:

I love the EoC, but seeing all these high level players with their high priced bullshit of pixels make me not want to play because of how shit my account is.

Read full topic

item.title: Time for a new start
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

xxlukexx:

The problem is more at the higher end of combat, not the lower end of it which is why you’re enjoying it more.

I finally started playing on my main account, and it is much better if you ask me. Slayer is especially fun to do.

Read full topic

The problem is more at the higher end of combat, not the lower end of it which is why you’re enjoying it more.

Big time.
Before eoc, i was worried about death from the LRC monsters.
Now, I can 3 hit them.

I can’t find anywhere good to train now >.>

item.title: Time for a new start
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

It has been really fun training at cows, plus there are a lot of new user-friendly interfaces and even some new items that have been added, both low level and high level things.

Read full topic

item.title: Time for a new start
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

I’ve tried it out myself. There are many entertaining aspects about the EoC, and to give it a shot is definitely worth your time.
I’ll edit this post with something more critical after I am less tired. :o

Read full topic

item.title: Time for a new start
item.dc:creator: @TheLetterQArousesMe TheLetterQArousesMe
item.description:
@TheLetterQArousesMe wrote:

Actually, this opened my eyes to how stupid I was being.
I’m creating an account right now, time to actually play the EoC!

Read full topic

item.title: Time for a new start
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:481038”][quote author=Tutorial link=topic=599276.msg4211912#msg4211912 date=1359684774]
I’ve been judging these new updates on RuneScape by general feedback (mostly from this forum), so I never wanted to even log into the game and see the changes for myself. I decided to create a new account and learn about all the new updates by experience, and it has been really fun so far. There are a few things that could be better, or even completely changed, but the game is fun for the most part. In all honesty, I’ve never had this much fun training combat until now, and I’m only killing cows.

I really think most of you should reconsider your thought about the updates and try it out for yourself.
[/quote]
I’ll have to try this. Not learning combat via my high level account, but through a noob. Cause then you get a chance to learn all aspects, instead of being dumped in the middle of combat.[/quote]
I completely agree. The main problem on my main account is that I’m not quite sure how to use every ability in collaboration, and when to use abilities at a given time.

Read full topic
